text:
Hello all!
We are updating the contacts in HubSpot that we have in our internal database with different metrics through the python API v3. We do that through matching of email, where we match the user in our database against the primary and associated email in HubSpot. If there is a match we pull the contact's object_id and then we update the users by the object_id. If a user is not found in HubSpot, we create a new user.

Recently we have been having an issue with 3 different users which were originally created by this integration and have been updated for some time as well. Now, each pipeline call has a problem with one of these three users and it changes inbetween. Instead of updating the users, the code tries to create a new user which then triggers a conflict in HubSpot since the user already exists. I have looked at the email and names trying to find differences or whitespaces or any other thing that could interfere with the email-matching without finding anything. I have tried to do manual api calls for these users and manually updating the fields without issue. Has anyone else stumbled upon a similar issue with the API?

These are the methods we are using:
• `BatchInputSimplePublicObjectBatchInput`
• `PublicObjectSearchRequest`
• `BatchInputSimplePublicObjectInputForCreate`

<#C2YHAHB6K|api>
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/reference/api/library/files#get-%2Ffiles%2Fv3%2Ffiles%2F%7Bfileid%7D%2Fsigned-url|Get signed URL to access private file>  in this api endpoints "expirationSeconds" are not working
If any one know about it please help me out
Hello, we are trying to create a note using one uploaded file and <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/guides/api/crm/engagements/notes#associations>
my question the sending payload should be json encoded when we send it?
I've run into the same issue. Did you discover a solution?
Let me check my PR to see if they have a response
In my case, it seems the issue was simply ensuring the content type was set to `application/json` in the headers

Hello, I'm looking to make an integration with an external provider in such a way that they, from their whatsapp AI service, can send us conversations into our HubSpot inbox. The thing is that I'm currently in need of the API key (which I have from a private application) and I also need the route from the API to add this new conversations. Does anyone know where can I get the route for making the integration?

Hi folks, we have a job running against many HubSpot’s accounts via HubSpot API. We have some questions about the API’s quota limits.
Is there any shared (or partner) quota limitation for those API?
Is there’s quota limitation per IP ?

Hi <@U083S9VFJ2F> :wave:
The *expirationSeconds* query parameter is used to control _"how long in seconds the link will provide access to the file"_. For example, if set to "60", the file would remain accessible via the signed URL for about 1 minute. Looks like you're trying to set this parameter as a timestamp, rather than a duration in seconds. Hopefully it's that simple :fingerscrossed:

Hi <@U07V15UERT3> :wave:
If you haven't already, might be worth reading HubSpot's <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/guides/apps/api-usage/usage-details|API Usage Guidelines>. What's your authentication method (e.g. Public App, Private App)?

<@U06TS55PT4H>
Thanks for replying me, I'm using expirationSeconds as a timestamp like '1734674026'
I'm using this website to convert time into timestamp: <https://www.epochconverter.com/>
